quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 11 Quiz 2
quiz.subtitle: 11.2: Arc Length and Sector Area
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Calculating geometric properties with radian measure

questions.question: Find the arc length of a circle with a radius of $6$ cm and a central angle of $\frac{\pi}{3}$ radians.
A pizza with a radius of $8$ inches is cut into sectors. What is the area of a sector with a central angle of $\frac{\pi}{4}$ radians?
Find the central angle (in radians) of an arc with a length of $10$ inches and a radius of $5$ inches.
A circular irrigation system covers an area defined by a radius of $100$ meters and a central angle of $1$ radian. What is the area covered?
If the arc length of a sector is $12$ cm and the central angle is $3$ radians, what is the radius of the circle?
A pendulum of length $2$ feet swings through an angle of $30^{\circ}$. Find the distance the tip of the pendulum travels (arc length).
questions.explanation: First, convert 30Â° to radians: $30 \times \frac{\pi}{180} = \frac{\pi}{6}$. Then $s = r\theta = 2 \times \frac{\pi}{6} = \frac{\pi}{3}$.

questions.question: Find the area of a sector that has a radius of $0.5$ meters and a central angle of $2$ radians.
What happens to the area of a sector if the radius is doubled but the angle remains the same?
A wheel with a diameter of $20$ inches rotates through an angle of $4$ radians. How far does a point on the rim travel?
Find the area of a sector with a radius of $12$ cm if the arc length is $6$ cm.
